supervisor_account

Who

40 students from many countries and of all ages, coming to Pisa and Florence to discover the Lights of Tuscany.

today

When

From the 15th to the 19th of May 2025, arrival and departures included.

location_on

Where

Three days in Pisa, two in Florence. Check out the schedule in the Programme section to see all the places, laboratories and universities you will have the opportunity to visit.

  • Coming Soon!

    Coming Soon!

send

The event is open to all students of the International Association of Physics Students. It will bring 40 students to visit some of the most advanced research facilities in Tuscany, with a focus on Photonics and Optics and one key mission: to foster enthusiasm in the minds of young physicists. AISF Local committees of Pisa and Florence are aiting for you at the Lights of Tuscany programme, now at its sixth edition!

Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica

The Associazione Italiana Studenti di Fisica (AISF) is a non-profit organization with educational purposes that gathers together all the Italian students of physics. It was founded in Heidelberg in August 2014 and since January 2015 is a National Committee of the International Association of Physics Students (IAPS). It counts more than 1000 members and 16 Local Committees.
